snippet: John R. Allen said it would take up to a year to prepare the Iraqi military for a campaign to retake Mosul, which is held by ISIS.
abstract: Retired Gen John R Allen, American official coordinating international coalition fighting Islamic State, says it will take as much as a year to prepare Iraqi army for campaign to retake Mosul, largest Iraqi city under insurgent control.

byline.contributor: An Iraqi employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Tikrit, Iraq, Michelle Innis from Sydney, and Ian Austen from Ottawa.

lead_paragraph: John R. Allen said it would take up to a year to prepare the Iraqi military for a campaign to retake Mosul, which is held by ISIS.

headline.main: Coalition Leader Warns of Long Fight Against ISIS in Iraq
headline.print_headline: Coalition Leader Warns of Long Fight in Iraq

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
